thread.title: Tuesday's After-Hours Movers: Diamond Foods, Barracuda Networks, COMSCORE & Williams Companies - Yahoo Finance
thread.title_full: Tuesday's After-Hours Movers: Diamond Foods, Barracuda Networks, COMSCORE & Williams Companies - Yahoo Finance

author: Javier Hasse
title: Tuesday's After-Hours Movers: Diamond Foods, Barracuda Networks, COMSCORE & Williams Companies - Yahoo Finance
text:
Shares of Diamond Foods, Inc. (NASDAQ: DMND ) were down about 4 percent in Tuesday’s after-hours session, following the announcement of the company’s fourth quarter financial results.
The small-cap packaged food company reported earnings of $0.23 per share, above the Street’s consensus estimate of $0.22 per share. Revenue of $201.81 million came short of expectations for sales of $205.4 million.
Barracuda Networks Inc (NYSE: CUDA ) was also falling on its earnings report. The stock plummeted more than 15 percent, even though earnings of $0.10 per share on revenue of $78.37 million were pretty much in line with the Street’s consensus .
View more earnings on DMND 
The biggest gainer in the afternoon was COMSCORE, Inc. (NASDAQ: SCOR ), up more than 6 percent after the market closed. The company agreed to acquire competitor Rentrak Corporation (NASDAQ: RENT ), which was down 0.81 percent after hours. According to The Wall Street Journal, the merger could create a “more formidable rival to No. 1 player Nielsen.”
Also on the rise Williams Companies Inc (NYSE: WMB ), up more than 5 percent after the bell. The surge may be a correction of the decline the stock experienced during the day, which was driven by the announcement that the company has agreed to be acquired by Energy Transfer Equity LP (NYSE: ETE ), which was also up almost 3 percent in after-hours trading.
Disclosure: Javier Hasse holds no positions in any of the securities mentioned above.
